title.narrative: OUTP 1.2: HEALTH POLICY AND MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: Output 1.2: Strengthened commitment, partnerships and accountability to plan, budget, finance and monitor the scale-up of low-cost evidence-based health interventions, including in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Eighty per cent of pregnant women, new-borns, children and adolescents have equitable access to and utilize high-impact, cost-effective and quality health interventions and practice healthy behaviours by 2020

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND CHILD CARE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2: Strengthened commitment, partnerships and accountability to plan, budget, finance and monitor the scale-up of low-costevidence-based health interventions, including in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: In partnership with the government, through UNICEF’s financial and technical support, the proportion of facilities implementing Results Based Financing (RBF) remained 100%, (849 PHC facilities, 67 hospitals, 42 district health executives, 8 provincial health executives).Health Centre Committees were fully functional in all those health facilities for strengthened accountability. Facilities charging user-fees for pregnant/lactating women, under-5 children and over 65-year-old reduced and remain below 2% against a target of 5% due to the consistent quarterly financial support through RBF disbursements. UNICEF supported the Ministry of Health and Child Care to monitor continuity of essential services amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
